intro: Moraea polyphylla, commonly known as the many-leaved moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences that typically bloom in spring. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and produces multiple strap-like leaves that are often variegated. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
